original_title: Sri Lanka debt office raises 110.4 bn via bond auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka sold 110.44 billion rupees’ worth of bonds at an auction on Monday after offering 180 billion, data from the state debt office showed.
All 110 billion rupees of 01 May 2027 bonds were sold at 28.11 percent.
Only 441 million of the offered 70 billion rupees of 15 November 2024 bonds were sold at 29.99 percent.

An issuance window for the ISIN LKB00527E019 will be open until close of business of day prior to settlement date March 14, 2023 until 4.00pm at the Weighted Average Yield Rate (WAYR) determined for the said ISIN at the auction, up to 20 percent of the amount offered. (Colombo/ Mar 13/2023)
